SENT.plain: A 38-year-old woman with clinical T3N1M0 esophageal adenocarcinoma received an institutional protocol of induction chemotherapy, esophagectomy, and consolidation chemoradiotherapy
Three months after treatment, she had an acute mental status change develop and grand mal seizures
Intracranial imaging demonstrated massive cerebral air emboli, and a rapidly fatal neurologic deterioration ensued
At autopsy, a nonmalignant 0.5-cm gastric conduit to the left atrial fistula was identified
This case illustrates a rare, but fatal, late benign complication of aggressive therapy for locally advanced esophageal cancer
